card.name: Æthermage's Touch
card.ability: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. It has "At the beginning of your end step, return this creature to its owner's hand." Then put the rest of the cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : If you reveal more than one creature card, you may put up to one of them onto the battlefield, and the rest of the revealed cards go on the bottom of your library. If you don't reveal any creature cards, all the revealed cards go on the bottom of your library.
5/1/2006 : If the creature leaves the battlefield before the end of your turn, it won't return to your hand at the end of your turn.
5/1/2006 : If you put a creature onto the battlefield this way during your end-of-turn step, it won't be returned to your hand until the end of your next turn.
5/1/2006 : If the triggered ability granted to the creature is countered (with Voidslime, for example), the creature will stay on the battlefield. At the end of your next turn, the ability will trigger again.
5/1/2006 : If a creature such as Clone copies the creature, it will not copy the triggered ability.

card.name: Anthem of Rakdos
card.ability:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn and Anthem of Rakdos deals 1 damage to you.
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The first ability triggers once for each creature you attack with. If you attack with three creatures, for example, they'll each get +2/+0 and you'll be dealt 3 damage.
5/1/2006 : The hellbent ability doubles the damage dealt to you by Anthem of Rakdos itself.
5/1/2006 : If damage that would be dealt to a player or creature is affected by both Anthem of Rakdos and a damage prevention effect, that player or that creature's controller chooses the order to apply the effects. In most cases that player will want to prevent damage, then double what's left.
5/1/2006 : If a source you control would deal damage to multiple creatures and/or players simultaneously, all of that damage is doubled.

card.name: Aquastrand Spider
card.ability:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

card.name: Assault Zeppelid
card.ability: Flying, trample
card.flavor:
"Show them to Razia and then to the Azorius sky marshals. We could create a fine bidding war—enough to fund the final stages of Project Kraj."
—Momir Vig

card.name: Aurora Eidolon
card.ability:
{W}, Sacrifice Aurora Eidolon: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Aurora Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Avatar of Discord
card.ability:
({BR} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Flying
When Avatar of Discord enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard two cards.
card.flavor: Such is the power of Rakdos that even his shadow takes on a cruel life of its own.

card.name: Azorius Æthermage
card.ability: Whenever a permanent is returned to your hand, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor: In her single metasphere are bound the records of every Ætheric transaction since the time of Azor.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : This ability will trigger whenever any permanent, including a token creature or Azorius AEthermage itself, is returned to your hand. It doesn't matter who controlled the permanent or if it had ever actually been in your hand before.

card.name: Azorius Chancery
card.ability:
Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield tapped.
When Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

card.name: Azorius First-Wing
card.ability: Flying, protection from enchantments
card.flavor: With a steady diet of lawbreakers, Azorius griffins inevitably develop a resistance to the contraband magic that taints much of their prey.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : "Protection from enchantments" means that Azorius First-Wing can't be enchanted, it can't be targeted by Aura spells or by abilities of enchantments, all damage that would be dealt to it by enchantments is prevented, and it can't be blocked by creatures that are also enchantments.
5/1/2006 : If an effect tries to move an Aura onto this creature, the effect will fail and the Aura will stay where it was.
5/1/2006 : Azorius First-Wing doesn't have protection from creatures that are enchanted.

card.name: Azorius Guildmage
card.ability:
{2}{W}: Tap target creature.
{2}{U}: Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

card.name: Azorius Herald
card.ability:
Azorius Herald is unblockable.
When Azorius Herald enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
When Azorius Herald enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {U} was spent to cast it.
card.flavor:
"As peace should be—gentle yet unstoppable."
—Augustin IV
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Azorius Ploy
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
card.flavor: Azorius military tactics, like their legal tactics, capitalize on delay and nullification.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : The two targets may be the same creature or they may be different creatures.

card.name: Azorius Signet
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law—strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.

card.name: Beacon Hawk
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Beacon Hawk deals combat damage to a player, you may untap target creature.
{W}: Beacon Hawk gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Biomantic Mastery
card.ability:
({GU} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Draw a card for each creature target player controls, then draw a card for each creature another target player controls.
card.flavor:
"Look beyond, to the vascular awareness that all life is a map to greater knowledge."
—Momir Vig, Biomancy, vol. I
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : You choose both targets before you draw any cards. The targets must be different. One of them may be you.

card.name: Blessing of the Nephilim
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.
card.flavor: "Before the first stone was laid or the first elf-child born, the power of the nephilim was gathering. Let that power be spread by my hands."

card.name: Blood Crypt
card.ability:
({T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.)
As Blood Crypt enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Blood Crypt enters the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
10/1/2005 : Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land.  Things that affect basic lands don't affect it.  For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
10/1/2005 : If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.
10/1/2005 : If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

card.name: Bond of Agony
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Bond of Agony, pay X life.
Each other player loses X life.
card.flavor: The Rakdos are unique in designing torture equipment they can operate while "suffering" alongside their victims.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : You can't choose an X that's greater than your life total.
5/1/2006 : You can choose an X that's equal to your life total. If you do, you'll pay that much life when the spell is cast and will lose the game before it resolves.
4/15/2013 : You must pay both X life and {X}{B}. For example, if you want each other player to lose 2 life when Bond of Agony resolves, you must pay {2}{B} and 2 life.

card.name: Bound // Determined
card.ability:
Sacrifice a creature. Return up to X cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of colors that creature was. Exile this card.
//
Other spells you control can't be countered by spells or abilities this turn.
Draw a card.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : After Determined resolves, any spells or abilities that would counter a spell you control that turn will still resolve. They just won't counter that spell.
5/1/2006 : Spells you control may be countered by spells or abilities while Determined is on the stack, waiting to resolve.

card.name: Brace for Impact
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target multicolored creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
card.flavor: Flesh can be tempered by spellcraft and forged ever stronger by the hammers of foes.

card.name: Brain Pry
card.ability: Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand. That player discards a card with that name. If he or she can't, you draw a card.
card.flavor: To the Rakdos, the fun is in the shakedown. The loot is usually discarded.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : You name the card during Brain Pry's resolution, then the player reveals his or her hand and discards if appropriate. There is no way for the player to do anything between you naming the card and the player discarding.

card.name: Breeding Pool
card.ability:
({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Breeding Pool enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Breeding Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
10/1/2005 : Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land.  Things that affect basic lands don't affect it.  For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
10/1/2005 : If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.
10/1/2005 : If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

card.name: Bronze Bombshell
card.ability: When a player other than Bronze Bombshell's owner controls it, that player sacrifices it. If the player does, Bronze Bombshell deals 7 damage to him or her.
card.flavor:
"Ooh, shiny Let's pull off the chain and take her with us."
—Ukl, Gruul raider, last words
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : This ability is a state trigger. Once it triggers, it won't trigger again while the ability is on the stack. If the triggered ability leaves the stack and the creature is still on the battlefield under the control of a player other than its owner, the ability will immediately trigger again.
5/1/2006 : Bronze Bombshell deals 7 damage only if it was sacrificed as a result of its ability. If it leaves the battlefield or changes controllers before the ability resolves, it can't be sacrificed and won't deal damage.

card.name: Cackling Flames
card.ability:
Cackling Flames deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Hellbent — Cackling Flames deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor:
"I like a little entertainment with my dinner."
—Rakdos

card.name: Carom
card.ability:
The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Her enemy's strength is her own.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : If either target has left the battlefield before the damage would be dealt, that damage isn't redirected.
5/1/2006 : Carom's controller draws a card when Carom resolves, not when the damage is redirected.

card.name: Celestial Ancient
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
card.flavor:
"We thought the clouds had moved from the night sky. Then the night sky moved, and the horizon grew wings."
—Josuri

card.name: Coiling Oracle
card.ability: When Coiling Oracle enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.
card.flavor: Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.

card.name: Condemn
card.ability: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage
card.ruling: 8/15/2010 : The affected creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

card.name: Court Hussar
card.ability:
Vigilance
When Court Hussar enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library, then put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
When Court Hussar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {W} was spent to cast it.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Crime // Punishment
card.ability:
Put target creature or enchantment card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
//
Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X.

card.name: Crypt Champion
card.ability:
Double strike
When Crypt Champion enters the battlefield, each player puts a creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
When Crypt Champion enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {R} was spent to cast it.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The first triggered ability isn't targeted, so the creature cards aren't chosen until the ability resolves. Each player chooses which creature card from his or her own graveyard to return. If a player doesn't have an applicable creature card, that player does nothing. If a player does have any applicable cards, that player must return one to the battlefield.
5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Cytoplast Manipulator
card.ability:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{U}, {T}: Gain control of target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it for as long as Cytoplast Manipulator remains on the battlefield.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The control change lasts as long as Cytoplast Manipulator is on the battlefield. It doesn't end if the creature loses all its +1/+1 counters, it stops being a creature, or if Cytoplast Manipulator becomes untapped.
5/1/2006 : If the ability is activated and Cytoplast Manipulator leaves the battlefield before it resolves, the ability does nothing. The target creature will remain under its current controller's control.

card.name: Cytoplast Root-Kin
card.ability:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
When Cytoplast Root-Kin enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control that has a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature you control onto Cytoplast Root-Kin.

card.name: Cytoshape
card.ability: Choose a nonlegendary creature on the battlefield. Target creature becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Though highly effective at reshaping flesh, these specially bred cytoplasts leave the subject reeking of omnibian mucus."
—Simic research notes
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Only the creature that's becoming a copy is targeted. The creature that it will copy isn't chosen until Cytoshape resolves.
5/1/2006 : The creature copies the printed values of the chosen creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on that creature. It won't copy effects that have changed the creature's power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
5/1/2006 : If the creature copies a creature that's copying a creature, it will become whatever the chosen creature is copying.
5/1/2006 : If the creature becomes a copy of a face-down creature, it will become a 2/2 creature with no name, creature type, abilities, mana cost, or color. It will not become face-down and thus can't be turned face up.
5/1/2006 : This effect can cause the target to stop being a creature. For example, if it becomes a copy of an animated Blinkmoth Nexus, the printed wording will be copied and it will become an unanimated Blinkmoth Nexus.
5/1/2006 : Effects that have already applied to the target creature will continue to apply to it. For example, if Giant Growth had given it +3/+3 earlier in the turn, then Cytoshape makes it a copy of Grizzly Bears, it will be a 5/5 Grizzly Bears.
5/1/2006 : A creature may become a copy of itself this way. This generally won't have any visible effect.
5/1/2006 : At the end of the turn, the creature reverts to what it was before. If two Cytoshapes affect the same creature on the same turn, they'll both wear off at the same time.

card.name: Cytospawn Shambler
card.ability:
Graft 6 (This creature enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn.

card.name: Delirium Skeins
card.ability: Each player discards three cards.
card.flavor: There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : First the active player chooses which cards to discard, then the nonactive player chooses, then all cards are discarded at the same time. No one sees what the other players are discarding before deciding which cards to discard.

card.name: Supply // Demand
card.ability:
Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
//
Search your library for a multicolored card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Demonfire
card.ability:
Demonfire deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
Hellbent — If you have no cards in hand, Demonfire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.

card.name: Demon's Jester
card.ability:
Flying
Hellbent — Demon's Jester gets +2/+1 as long as you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: They knock 'em dead, with or without the punch line.

card.name: Research // Development
card.ability:
Choose up to four cards you own from outside the game and shuffle them into your library.
//
Put a 3/1 red Elemental creature token onto the battlefield unless any opponent has you draw a card. Repeat this process two more times.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Development's effect is repeated three times no matter which option the opponent chooses. The opponent may choose a different option each time. You'll wind up with three Elemental tokens, two tokens and a card, one token and two cards, or three cards, whichever your opponent chooses.
5/1/2006 : In a multiplayer game, each opponent, in turn, has the option to let you draw a card. If no opponent does, you put a token onto the battlefield. Then the process repeats two more times. A different opponent may let you draw a card each time.

card.name: Dovescape
card.ability:
({WU} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, counter that spell. That player puts X 1/1 white and blue Bird creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The Bird tokens are created even if the spell isn't countered by Dovescape's ability. This may happen because the spell can't be countered, because it's already been countered, or because it's otherwise been removed from the stack by the time Dovescape's ability resolves.
5/1/2006 : If a split card is cast, Dovescape makes tokens equal to the converted mana cost of the half that was cast.

card.name: Dread Slag
card.ability:
Trample
Dread Slag gets -4/-4 for each card in your hand.
card.flavor: A thousand phobias sopped from the city and wrung from Rix Maadi as one.

card.name: Drekavac
card.ability: When Drekavac enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a noncreature card.
card.flavor: Like a vulture's scalp, the face of a drekavac is oily and hairless. The filth and disease of its carrion diet slip off its blood-slick skin.

card.name: Elemental Resonance
card.ability:
Enchant permanent
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add mana equal to enchanted permanent's mana cost to your mana pool. (Mana cost includes color. If a mana symbol has multiple colors, choose one.)
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : If the enchanted permanent's mana cost is {2}{W}{U}, this Aura's controller adds {2}{W}{U} to his or her mana pool. If its mana cost is {X}{G}, this Aura's controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool. If its mana cost is (W/U)(W/U), this Aura's controller chooses whether to add {W}{W}, {W}{U}, or {U}{U} to his or her mana pool. The choice may be different each time the ability resolves.
5/1/2006 : This ability isn't a mana ability. It uses the stack.
5/1/2006 : Only the first main phase in a turn is the "precombat main phase," even if additional main phases are generated by some effect.
10/1/2009 : You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

card.name: Odds // Ends
card.ability:
Flip a coin. If it comes up heads, counter target instant or sorcery spell. If it comes up tails, copy that spell and you may choose new targets for the copy.
//
Target player sacrifices two attacking creatures.

card.name: Enemy of the Guildpact
card.ability: Protection from multicolored
card.flavor: Guilds often exterminate those who saw or knew too much. Some vindictive souls retain their knowledge, using it in the afterlife to crush the guilded and the vile bargain that gives them power.

card.name: Enigma Eidolon
card.ability:
{U}, Sacrifice Enigma Eidolon: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Enigma Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Entropic Eidolon
card.ability:
{B}, Sacrifice Entropic Eidolon: Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Entropic Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Trial // Error
card.ability:
Return all creatures blocking or blocked by target creature to their owner's hand.
//
Counter target multicolored spell.
card.artist: Ron Spears & Wayne Reynolds // Ron Spears & Wayne Reynolds

card.name: Evolution Vat
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on it. Until end of turn, that creature gains "{2}{G}{U}: Double the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature."
card.flavor: The vats are self-contained worlds, bubbling and churning with unnatural speed, boiling down eons of change into moments.

card.name: Experiment Kraj
card.ability:
Experiment Kraj has all activated abilities of each other creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor:
"Of course it will grow beyond control—it was designed to choose its own evolution."
—Momir Vig
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Unlike with cards like Quicksilver Elemental, the costs of the activated abilities Experiment Kraj gains must be paid with the correct colors of mana.

card.name: Rise // Fall
card.ability:
Return target creature card from a graveyard and target creature on the battlefield to their owners' hands.
//
Target player reveals two cards at random from his or her hand, then discards each nonland card revealed this way.

card.name: Fertile Imagination
card.ability: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal.

card.name: Flame-Kin War Scout
card.ability: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Flame-Kin War Scout. If you do, Flame-Kin War Scout deals 4 damage to that creature.
card.flavor:
"The forward flame-kin are popping. We have incoming"
—Svar, Boros signaler
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at the same time, Flame-Kin War Scout's ability will trigger multiple times. When the first of these triggers resolves, if Flame Kin War Scout can be sacrificed by the ability's controller, it will be sacrificed and deal 4 damage. When the other triggers resolve, it won't be on the battlefield, so it can't be sacrificed and the other creatures won't be dealt any damage.

card.name: Flaring Flame-Kin
card.ability: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: A flame-kin is always formidable, but feeding its fire with a sorcerous gift grants it the power to devastate armies.

card.name: Flash Foliage
card.ability:
Cast Flash Foliage only during combat after blockers are declared.
Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield blocking target creature attacking you.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"This undemanding vegetation takes root in a mote of dust but grows incredibly quickly."
—Simic research notes
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The Saproling token is blocking the attacking creature, even if the block couldn't legally be declared (for example, if the attacking creature has flying, or is Vindictive Mob).
5/1/2006 : Putting a blocking creature onto the battlefield doesn't trigger "When this creature blocks" abilities. It also won't check blocking restrictions, costs, or requirements.
5/1/2006 : Putting a blocking creature onto the battlefield will trigger "When this creature becomes blocked by a creature" abilities. It may trigger "When this creature becomes blocked" abilities, but only if the creature the Saproling is blocking had not yet been blocked that combat.
5/1/2006 : The target creature can be blocked by other creatures.
5/1/2006 : Flash Foliage can be cast only during an opponent's combat phase, after attackers have been declared. If it's cast after combat damage is dealt, the Saproling will enter the battlefield blocking the attacking creature, but will neither deal combat damage to it nor be dealt combat damage by it.
7/1/2006 : With the latest Oracle update, you can only cast this during combat, after blockers have been declared.

card.name: Freewind Equenaut
card.ability:
Flying
As long as Freewind Equenaut is enchanted, it has "{T}: Freewind Equenaut deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."
card.flavor: Confront her, and feel the hooves of her steed. Ignore her, and feel the sting of her arrow.

card.name: Ghost Quarter
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.
card.flavor: Where wasted life cries out to be reborn.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land is indestructible or because it was regenerated.
5/1/2006 : If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability will be countered because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.
9/22/2011 : If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

card.name: Gnat Alley Creeper
card.ability: Gnat Alley Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Despite its diminutive name, Gnat Alley is the longest street in Ravnica. Mile after twisting mile, it threads its way among the broader, safer thoroughfares like a parasite.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don’t actually have Flying.

card.name: Gobhobbler Rats
card.ability: Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, Gobhobbler Rats gets +1/+0 and has "{B}: Regenerate Gobhobbler Rats."
card.flavor: Lyzolda's pet rats eat better than the average citizen. In fact, they can usually be found eating the average citizen.

card.name: Govern the Guildless
card.ability:
Gain control of target monocolored creature.
Forecast — {1}{U}, Reveal Govern the Guildless from your hand: Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Grand Arbiter Augustin IV
card.ability:
White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor: The Arbiter is a conduit of justice, a will so disciplined that it dispenses justice without ego or remorse.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Spells you cast that are both blue and white cost {2} less to cast.
5/1/2006 : This reduces only generic mana costs. A spell you cast with mana cost {1}{W}{U} will cost {W}{U} to cast.

card.name: Guardian of the Guildpact
card.ability: Protection from monocolored
card.flavor: The magic of the Guildpact gives aegis to the spirits pressed into its service. Upon entering the afterlife, they find new focus and are charged with defending the Guildpact against those who would see it broken.

card.name: Haazda Exonerator
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Haazda Exonerator: Destroy target Aura.
card.flavor: "This aura threatens the sanctity of your soul. Wrenching it free won't be easy on either of us. If you're ready, we'll begin."

card.name: Haazda Shield Mate
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Haazda Shield Mate unless you pay {W}{W}.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: The Haazda shield is broad, protecting both the free and the guilded.

card.name: Hallowed Fountain
card.ability:
({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
10/1/2005 : Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land.  Things that affect basic lands don't affect it.  For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
10/1/2005 : If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.
10/1/2005 : If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

card.name: Helium Squirter
card.ability:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Hellhole Rats
card.ability:
Haste
When Hellhole Rats enters the battlefield, target player discards a card. Hellhole Rats deals damage to that player equal to that card's converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"I must speak with Momir Vig about creating a water-spouting watchdog."
—Mathvan, Prahv scrollwarden

card.name: Hide // Seek
card.ability:
Put target artifact or enchantment on the bottom of its owner's library.
//
Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.artist: Zoltan Boros & Gabor Szikszai // Zoltan Boros & Gabor Szikszai

card.name: Hit // Run
card.ability:
Target player sacrifices an artifact or creature. Hit deals damage to that player equal to that permanent's converted mana cost.
//
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking creature.

card.name: Ignorant Bliss
card.ability: Exile all cards from your hand face down. At the beginning of the next end step, return those cards to your hand, then draw a card.
card.flavor:
"A quick step beyond oblivion lies a place so full of thoughts that it leaves no room for your own."
—Quyzl, chronarch prodigy
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : No player may look at the cards while they're face down.
5/1/2006 : If you cast this during the End step, you won't return the cards to your hand or draw a card until the next turn's End step.
5/1/2006 : If the delayed triggered ability is countered (for example, with Voidslime), the cards remain exiled forever.

card.name: Indrik Stomphowler
card.ability: When Indrik Stomphowler enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"An indrik's howl has destructive power much subtler than that of its crushing foot. The sound is mundane, but inaudible vibrations scatter and sunder magical contrivances."
—Simic research notes

card.name: Infernal Tutor
card.ability:
Reveal a card from your hand. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Hellbent — If you have no cards in hand, instead search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Isperia the Inscrutable
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Isperia the Inscrutable deals combat damage to a player, name a card. That player reveals his or her hand. If he or she reveals the named card, search your library for a creature card with flying, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : The card is named when the ability resolves. The named card can't be played after it's named but before the player's hand is revealed.

card.name: Jagged Poppet
card.ability:
Whenever Jagged Poppet is dealt damage, discard that many cards.
Hellbent — Whenever Jagged Poppet deals combat damage to a player, if you have no cards in hand, that player discards cards equal to the damage.
card.flavor: Few puppets are so willing.

card.name: Kill-Suit Cultist
card.ability:
Kill-Suit Cultist attacks each turn if able.
{B}, Sacrifice Kill-Suit Cultist: The next time damage would be dealt to target creature this turn, destroy that creature instead.
card.flavor: Dressed to kill.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : This ability causes a creature to be destroyed instead of being dealt damage. Damage replaced this way isn't dealt, and effects that would happen based on this damage (such as Demonfire's "exile it" effect) don't happen.

card.name: Kindle the Carnage
card.ability: Discard a card at random. If you do, Kindle the Carnage deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to each creature. You may repeat this process any number of times.
card.flavor: "Start knockin' heads, boys, and don't stop 'til the ragamuffyn sings"
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : You decide whether to repeat the process after each iteration. In other words, you discard a card, see what it is, Kindle the Carnage deals damage, then you decide whether to continue. If so, you discard a card, see what it is, Kindle the Carnage deals damage, then you decide whether to continue, and so on.
5/1/2006 : Any damage prevention or regeneration abilities must be activated before Kindle the Carnage starts resolving in order to have any effect. You can't wait to see which (if any) cards are discarded.
5/1/2006 : A creature that's been dealt lethal damage by an iteration of this effect will remain on the battlefield and be dealt more damage by any further iterations. After you stop, all creatures that have been dealt lethal damage are put into their owners' graveyards at the same time.
5/1/2006 : All the damage has the same source. However, each iteration of this process is a separate instance of damage. An effect that prevents damage the "next time" this card would deal it will prevent damage from only one iteration.
5/1/2006 : A single regeneration shield is sufficient to save a particular creature, no matter how many instances of damage are on it.

card.name: Leafdrake Roost
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{G}{U}, {T}: Put a 2/2 green and blue Drake creature token with flying onto the battlefield."
card.flavor:
"The best experiments are those whose successes replicate themselves."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

card.name: Loaming Shaman
card.ability: When Loaming Shaman enters the battlefield, target player shuffles any number of target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
card.flavor: His work determines who is remembered and who feeds the worms.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Loaming Shaman's controller chooses all the targets when the ability is put on the stack.

card.name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch
card.ability: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch deals 2 damage to target creature or player if the sacrificed creature was red. Draw a card if the sacrificed creature was black.
card.flavor: Sacrificial rites take place before an audience of cheering cultists, each begging to be the next on stage.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : You can sacrifice any creature you control to pay for this ability. If the creature was neither red nor black, the ability has no effect.
5/1/2006 : You must choose a target for the ability, even if the creature you sacrifice isn't red. If the target becomes illegal before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered; you won't draw a card, even if the creature you sacrificed was black.

card.name: Macabre Waltz
card.ability: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.
card.flavor:
"All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."
—Savra

card.name: Magewright's Stone
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Untap target creature that has an activated ability with {T} in its cost.
card.flavor: The stones hark back to an age before civilization, when the living earth blessed all who trod its untamed wilds.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : If an activated ability with {T} in its cost is granted to a creature by an effect (such as Hypervolt Grasp's effect, for instance), Magewright's Stone can untap that creature.
5/1/2006 : This looks for the {T} symbol. The phrase "tap an untapped creature you control" isn't the same and doesn't count.

card.name: Might of the Nephilim
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each of its colors.
card.flavor:
"Send a runner to Tin Street, and tell 'em the delivery has been . . . uh . . . held up."
—Bonmod, caravan rear guard

card.name: Minister of Impediments
card.ability:
({WU} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: When it takes forever to learn all the rules, no time is left for breaking them.

card.name: Mistral Charger
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds.

card.name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
Whenever you cast a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If you cast a green and blue creature spell, both abilities will trigger. The abilities may be stacked so that when they resolve, you search your library for a creature card, put it on top of your library, and then put that card into your hand. The abilities may also be stacked in the other order, of course.

card.name: Muse Vessel
card.ability:
{3}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{1}: Choose a card exiled with Muse Vessel. You may play that card this turn.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Only cards exiled as a result of the first ability can be played as a result of the second ability.

card.name: Nettling Curse
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
{1}{R}: Enchanted creature attacks this turn if able.
card.flavor:
"I call them ‘Poke' and ‘Prod.'"
—Chagrach, Rakdos cursemage

card.name: Nightcreep
card.ability: Until end of turn, all creatures become black and all lands become Swamps.
card.flavor:
"Please tell me I'm hallucinating. I'd rather be crazy than here."
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : This effect overwrites all creatures' colors. Creatures will be black instead of any other color or colors.
5/1/2006 : This effect overwrites all lands' land types. Lands will be Swamps instead of any other land types. This won't affect a land's supertypes (such as basic or legendary). Lands will lose their normal abilities and have the ability "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool" instead.
5/1/2006 : If a permanent is both a creature and a land, Nightcreep replaces all of its land types with Swamp, but it doesn't affect its creature types. The creature land loses all abilities generated by its rules text and its previous land types but retains any abilities granted to it by other effects. For example, an animated Blinkmoth Nexus becomes a black creature land with the land subtype Swamp whose only abilities are flying and "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool."
5/1/2006 : A land or creature that enters the battlefield after Nightcreep resolves won't be affected by it.

card.name: Nihilistic Glee
card.ability:
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Hellbent — {1}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: "All ends in obliteration—love in hatred, life in death, and light in empty darkness."

card.name: Novijen Sages
card.ability:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}, Remove two +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Draw a card.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : To activate the activated ability, either remove two +1/+1 counters from a single creature you control or remove one +1/+1 counter from each of two different creatures you control.

card.name: Novijen, Heart of Progress
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G}{U}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature that entered the battlefield this turn.
card.flavor:
"The unnatural pressures of life in this city are best withstood by lifeforms that adapt with unnatural swiftness."
—Momir Vig
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : The second ability puts a counter on each applicable creature regardless of who controls it.

card.name: Ocular Halo
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Draw a card."
{W}: Enchanted creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
card.flavor: While the soldier dreams, the eyes stand watch.

card.name: Ogre Gatecrasher
card.ability: When Ogre Gatecrasher enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with defender.
card.flavor: A popular game among ogres is to see how many revolutions a head can make before it pops off.

card.name: Omnibian
card.ability: {T}: Target creature becomes a 3/3 Frog until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"This creature has hyperevolved chameleonic abilities. It no longer mimics its surroundings, instead forcing them to take on its form."
—Simic research notes
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : If the target creature has any counters on it that modify its power and toughness (such as a +1/+1 counter), those counters will continue to affect the creature after it becomes 3/3. In the example given, it will be 4/4.
10/1/2009 : If the target creature is affected by any effects that modify its power or toughness without setting them to specific values (such as from Giant Growth), Omnibian's effect will be applied before those effects. In the example given, the creature will be 6/6.
4/15/2013 : This effect changes only the power, toughness, and creature type of the targeted creature. It does not cause that creature to lose any abilities.

card.name: Overrule
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.
card.flavor: With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : You gain the life whether or not the spell's controller pays {X} and whether or not the spell is countered.

card.name: Pain Magnification
card.ability: Whenever an opponent is dealt 3 or more damage by a single source, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: The Rakdos make sure their victims remember their pain—or at least give up a little bit of their sanity in order to forget.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : This triggers only if all 3 or more damage is dealt at the same time.  It doesn't trigger if damage that adds up to 3 or more is dealt at different times by the same source.
5/1/2006 : If a source deals 3 or more damage to multiple opponents at the same time, this ability will trigger once for each of those opponents. They will each have to discard a card.

card.name: Paladin of Prahv
card.ability:
Whenever Paladin of Prahv deals damage, you gain that much life.
Forecast — {1}{W}, Reveal Paladin of Prahv from your hand: Whenever target creature deals damage this turn, you gain that much life. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Palliation Accord
card.ability:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a shield counter on Palliation Accord.
Remove a shield counter from Palliation Accord: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

card.name: Patagia Viper
card.ability:
Flying
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 green and blue Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield.
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {U} was spent to cast it.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Pillar of the Paruns
card.ability: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a multicolored spell.
card.flavor: Built on the very ground where the Ten signed the Guildpact, the tower is a monument to the past and a reminder of who holds power in the present.

card.name: Plaxcaster Frogling
card.ability:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{2}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

card.name: Plaxmanta
card.ability:
Flash
When Plaxmanta enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
When Plaxmanta enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {G} was spent to cast it.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Plumes of Peace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Forecast — {W}{U}, Reveal Plumes of Peace from your hand: Tap target creature. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Prahv, Spires of Order
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}{W}{U}, {T}: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
card.flavor: Prahv, where much work is done to make sure nothing is accomplished.

card.name: Pride of the Clouds
card.ability:
Flying
Pride of the Clouds gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.
Forecast — {2}{W}{U}, Reveal Pride of the Clouds from your hand: Put a 1/1 white and blue Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Proclamation of Rebirth
card.ability:
Return up to three target creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Forecast — {5}{W}, Reveal Proclamation of Rebirth from your hand: Return target creature card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Proper Burial
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor: Properly honored dead gain the peace of the grave and freedom from the call of the Ghost Quarter.

card.name: Protean Hulk
card.ability: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Meat and eggs. We eat"
—Borborygmos

card.name: Psychic Possession
card.ability:
Enchant opponent
Skip your draw step.
Whenever enchanted opponent draws a card, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "You will do the thinking for the both of us"
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Enchanting an opponent works very much like enchanting a permanent. The Aura spell targets the opponent. When it resolves, it enters the battlefield "attached" to that player. Once it's on the battlefield, it no longer targets that player.
5/1/2006 : Psychic Possession's controller, not the enchanted player, skips his or her draw step.
5/1/2006 : If Psychic Possession's controller ever happens to be the player it's enchanting, Psychic Possession will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.
5/1/2006 : An Aura with enchant opponent can't be attached to a permanent.
5/1/2006 : In a multiplayer game, if the enchanted opponent leaves the game, Psychic Possession will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action. If Psychic Possession's owner leaves the game, Psychic Possession immediately leaves the game; this is not a state-based action.

card.name: Psychotic Fury
card.ability:
Target multicolored creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Rage, my servants. Our ancient power is renewed in blood."
—Rakdos

card.name: Pure // Simple
card.ability:
Destroy target multicolored permanent.
//
Destroy all Auras and Equipment.

card.name: Ragamuffyn
card.ability: Hellbent — {T}, Sacrifice a creature or land: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: They cut the stitches and give her sips of her brew. Then they sew her up again, and she's back to stirring.

card.name: Rain of Gore
card.ability: If a spell or ability would cause its controller to gain life, that player loses that much life instead.
card.flavor:
"Stay indoors, away from what seeps over the thresholds. This is the Demon's work, and only ill can come of it."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : This does not apply to life gain caused by combat damage from a creature with lifelink.

card.name: Rakdos Augermage
card.ability:
First strike
{T}: Reveal your hand and discard a card of target opponent's choice. Then that player reveals his or her hand and discards a card of your choice. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "Great minds bleed alike."

card.name: Rakdos Carnarium
card.ability:
Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

card.name: Rakdos Guildmage
card.ability:
({BR} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
{3}{B}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{3}{R}: Put a 2/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If the second ability is activated during the End step, the token won't be exiled until the following turn's End step.

card.name: Rakdos Ickspitter
card.ability: {T}: Rakdos Ickspitter deals 1 damage to target creature and that creature's controller loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Our thrulls dissolve from the inside out in a matter of days. Shoddy work, but they're a scream while they last."
—Uzric, Rakdos guildmage

card.name: Rakdos Pit Dragon
card.ability:
{R}{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gains flying until end of turn.
{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Hellbent — Rakdos Pit Dragon has double strike as long as you have no cards in hand.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If Rakdos Pit Dragon loses double strike after first strike combat damage has been dealt, it won't deal damage during the normal combat damage step.

card.name: Rakdos Riteknife
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each blood counter on Rakdos Riteknife and has "{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a blood counter on Rakdos Riteknife."
{B}{R}, Sacrifice Rakdos Riteknife: Target player sacrifices a permanent for each blood counter on Rakdos Riteknife.
Equip {2}

card.name: Rakdos Signet
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Made of bone and boiled in blood, a Rakdos signet is not considered finished until it has been used as a murder weapon.

card.name: Rakdos the Defiler
card.ability:
Flying, trample
Whenever Rakdos the Defiler attacks, sacrifice half the non-Demon permanents you control, rounded up.
Whenever Rakdos deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices half the non-Demon permanents he or she controls, rounded up.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : To calculate the number of permanents that must be sacrificed, count the number of permanents the affected player controls that don't have the subtype Demon, then divide that number in half and round up. For example, a player who controls eleven non-Demon permanents will need to sacrifice six of them.
5/1/2006 : A permanent with the subtype Demon, including Rakdos the Defiler itself, can't be sacrificed this way.

card.name: Ratcatcher
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Rat card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: An ogre's poisonous stench is like fine Kashkaval cheese to the noses lowest to the ground.

card.name: Riot Spikes
card.ability:
({BR} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
card.flavor: Most auramancers would have let the spikes hover just above the skin. Having the spikes rip through the skin from beneath was a touch added by Rakdos himself.

card.name: Rix Maadi, Dungeon Palace
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}{R}, {T}: Each player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: Even miles away, if you put your ear to the sewer vents, you can hear the screams and the tempestuous laughter.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : When the second ability resolves, first the active player chooses a card to discard, then the nonactive player chooses, then all chosen cards are discarded at the same time. No one sees what the other players are discarding before deciding which cards to discard.

card.name: Sandstorm Eidolon
card.ability:
{R}, Sacrifice Sandstorm Eidolon: Target creature can't block this turn.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Sandstorm Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Seal of Doom
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discrete to dissolve one's victim entirely."
—Szadek

card.name: Seal of Fire
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"If it breathes, it will burn."
—Rakdos pyromancers' creed

card.name: Shielding Plax
card.ability:
({GU} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Enchant creature
When Shielding Plax enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : This is not the same as hexproof. If, for example, you target one of your opponent's creatures, your opponents won't be able to target their own creature with spells or abilities.

card.name: Silkwing Scout
card.ability:
Flying
{G}, Sacrifice Silkwing Scout: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Simic Basilisk
card.ability:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat."

card.name: Simic Growth Chamber
card.ability:
Simic Growth Chamber enters the battlefield tapped.
When Simic Growth Chamber enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{U} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

card.name: Simic Guildmage
card.ability:
({GU} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
{1}{G}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto another target creature with the same controller.
{1}{U}: Attach target Aura enchanting a permanent to another permanent with the same controller.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : For the first ability, the first target creature doesn't need to have a +1/+1 counter on it. If it doesn't, the ability does nothing.
5/1/2006 : For the first ability, if the two target creatures aren't controlled by the same player when the ability resolves, the ability does nothing. The player who controls the two creatures doesn't have to be the same player who controlled them when the ability was activated, and that player doesn't have to be Simic Guildmage's controller.
5/1/2006 : For the second ability, only the Aura is targeted. When the ability resolves, you choose a permanent to move the Aura onto. It can't be the permanent the Aura is already attached to, it must be controlled by the player who controls the permanent the Aura is attached to, and it must be able to be enchanted by the Aura. (It doesn't matter who controls the Aura or who controls Simic Guildmage.) If no such permanent exists, the Aura doesn't move.

card.name: Simic Initiate
card.ability: Graft 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
card.flavor: Simic initiates begin their training as experimental subjects. Failures are flushed to the undersewers.

card.name: Simic Ragworm
card.ability: {U}: Untap Simic Ragworm.
card.flavor:
"Infused with autochthon blood for size and hellion cells for speed, the ragworm is perfect for clearing the undergardens of both rats and vagrants."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

card.name: Simic Signet
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {G}{U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: For the Simic Combine, its sigil serves not as an emblem of honor but as a trademark. Its familiar image on any biological commodity attests to superb craftsmanship, ingenious innovation, and higher cost.

card.name: Simic Sky Swallower
card.ability:
Flying, trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"We've bred out the shortcomings of the species' natural form and replaced them with assets of our own design."
—Momir Vig

card.name: Skullmead Cauldron
card.ability:
{T}: You gain 1 life.
{T}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Once tasted, the flavor of skullmead lingers in the throat, a secret brand of guilt for those who partake in forbidden pleasures.

card.name: Sky Hussar
card.ability:
Flying
When Sky Hussar enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
Forecast — Tap two untapped white and/or blue creatures you control, Reveal Sky Hussar from your hand: Draw a card. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Skyscribing
card.ability:
Each player draws X cards.
Forecast — {2}{U}, Reveal Skyscribing from your hand: Each player draws a card. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Slaughterhouse Bouncer
card.ability: Hellbent — When Slaughterhouse Bouncer dies, if you have no cards in hand, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A Rakdos party is a flop if anyone lives to talk about it.

card.name: Slithering Shade
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Slithering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Hellbent — Slithering Shade can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you have no cards in hand.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : If you declare Slithering Shade as an attacker, then a card is put into your hand, the Shade won't be removed from combat. It continues to attack.

card.name: Soulsworn Jury
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Soulsworn Jury: Counter target creature spell.
card.flavor: In death, as in life, they protect the Grand Arbiter from exposure to contrary points of view.

card.name: Spell Snare
card.ability: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 2.
card.flavor: Every culture has its unlucky numbers. In a city where you're either alone, in a crowd, or being stabbed in the back, two is the worst number of all.

card.name: Sporeback Troll
card.ability:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Sprouting Phytohydra
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, you may put a token that's a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: A hydra tender's problem isn't having enough defenses but enough pots.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : A token copy of Sprouting Phytohydra is created even if the damage dealt to Sprouting Phytohydra destroys it.
5/1/2006 : If a token copy of Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, it will create another token copy.
5/1/2006 : If Cytoshape turns a creature into a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra, and that creature is dealt damage, the token that is put onto the battlefield is simply a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra. At the end of the turn, the Cytoshaped creature will revert back to what it was, but the token copying it will not.

card.name: Squealing Devil
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {B} was spent to cast it.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : For this creature to not be sacrificed, {B} must have been spent on the {1}{R} mana cost. It doesn't matter if {B} is spent on {X}.
5/1/2006 : You choose the value of X as Squealing Devil's ability resolves. X can be 0.
5/1/2006 : If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can’t have been paid, and you’ll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Stalking Vengeance
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever another creature you control dies, it deals damage equal to its power to target player.
card.flavor: Something roams the killing places, sniffing the guilt of the slayers, stalking them on iron paws.

card.name: Steeling Stance
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Forecast — {W}, Reveal Steeling Stance from your hand: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

card.name: Stoic Ephemera
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
When Stoic Ephemera blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
card.flavor: "Life is fleeting, and so is death. Only the oath is eternal."

card.name: Stomp and Howl
card.ability: Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Mizzium may be impervious to fire, but obviously certain other things can . . . modify its form."
—Ivos Koba, indrik handler
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : This spell can't be cast unless there are both an artifact and an enchantment on the battlefield to target. If a permanent is both an artifact and an enchantment, it can be both targets.

card.name: Stormscale Anarch
card.ability: {2}{R}, Discard a card at random: Stormscale Anarch deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If the discarded card was multicolored, Stormscale Anarch deals 4 damage to that creature or player instead.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : You can't discard a card at random, see what it is, and then decide whether or not to pay the mana. Mana abilities must be activated before costs are paid. At the time you pay the cost of discarding a card, you either have enough mana in your mana pool to pay the {2}{R}, in which case you must continue no matter what you discarded, or you don't have enough mana in your mana pool to pay the {2}{R}, in which case you must back up no matter what you discarded.

card.name: Street Savvy
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can block creatures with landwalk abilities as though they didn't have those abilities.
card.flavor: "It takes more than swift feet and dark shadows to slip by me unnoticed."
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : "Landwalk abilities" are abilities such as "forestwalk" or "legendary landwalk" that have "walk" in the name and make the creature with the ability unblockable as long as the defending player controls a land matching the description.

card.name: Swift Silence
card.ability: Counter all other spells. Draw a card for each spell countered this way.
card.flavor:
"This world may not know peace, but in my presence you will know quiet."
—Augustin IV

card.name: Taste for Mayhem
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
Hellbent — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+0 as long as you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: The taste of blood breaks down what little self-control the Rakdos possess.

card.name: Thrive
card.ability: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of X target creatures.
card.flavor: The most successful of Simic creations is cytoplasm, a living, symbiotic substance that feeds off genetic rhythms and strengthens its host in return.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means X different creatures. You can't give more than one +1/+1 counter to a creature with this spell.

card.name: Tidespout Tyrant
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: He unmakes the world in his own image.

card.name: Transguild Courier
card.flavor: Reluctant to meet face to face, the leaders of the ten guilds prefer to do official business through a go-between immune to bribes and threats.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Transguild Courier appears in a multicolored card frame, but it's still an artifact.
9/22/2011 : This card is white, blue, black, red, and green in all zones. It is multicolored.

card.name: Trygon Predator
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Trygon Predator deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment that player controls.
card.flavor: Held aloft by metabolized magic, trygons are ravenous for sources of mystic fuel.

card.name: Twinstrike
card.ability:
Twinstrike deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.
Hellbent — Destroy those creatures instead if you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: They're dying left and right.

card.name: Unliving Psychopath
card.ability:
{B}: Unliving Psychopath gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with power less than Unliving Psychopath's power.
card.flavor:
"The victim bears the marks of the ‘Ktozok Impaler'. . . but he was executed years ago"
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : The creature must have less power than Unliving Psychopath both when the ability is activated and when it resolves.

card.name: Utopia Sprawl
card.ability:
Enchant Forest
As Utopia Sprawl enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever enchanted Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of the chosen color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

card.name: Utvara Scalper
card.ability:
Flying
Utvara Scalper attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: He wages war wherever the wind carries him.

card.name: Valor Made Real
card.ability: Target creature can block any number of creatures this turn.
card.flavor: "As my father taught, ‘Training will raise your shield to the blow, but courage fills the gaps the shield leaves open.'"

card.name: Verdant Eidolon
card.ability:
{G}, Sacrifice Verdant Eidolon: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Verdant Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Vesper Ghoul
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Nature's exceptions remind us not to think in absolutes. Just as the orchid blossoms on blackened stone, so does the gift of mana occasionally manifest in the undead."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

card.name: Vigean Graftmage
card.ability:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{U}: Untap target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Vigean Hydropon
card.ability:
Graft 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
Vigean Hydropon can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Fruits of magic, roots in science.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Even though this creature can't attack, it doesn't have defender.

card.name: Vigean Intuition
card.ability: Choose a card type, then reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal.

card.name: Vision Skeins
card.ability: Each player draws two cards.
card.flavor: "I could see in the other mage's eyes that he'd thought of it too. Then it became a race to exploit the knowledge first."

card.name: Voidslime
card.ability: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
card.flavor:
"It is technically an ooze, but its lifespan measures only seconds. In that short time, its appetite for magic is extraordinary."
—Simic research notes

card.name: Wakestone Gargoyle
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{1}{W}: Creatures you control with defender can attack this turn as though they didn't have defender.
card.flavor: Its pulsating cry shatters bonds of iron, granite, and servitude.
card.ruling:
5/1/2006 : Wakestone Gargoyle's ability allows itself to attack.
5/1/2006 : Wakestone Gargoyle's ability will affect creatures with defender that come under your control after the ability resolves but before you declare attackers (though those creatures still can't attack unless they have haste).

card.name: Walking Archive
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Walking Archive enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player draws a card for each +1/+1 counter on Walking Archive.
{2}{W}{U}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Walking Archive.

card.name: War's Toll
card.ability:
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, tap all lands that player controls.
If a creature an opponent controls attacks, all creatures that opponent controls attack if able.
card.flavor: Razia, archangel of war, demands total commitment.

card.name: Weight of Spires
card.ability: Weight of Spires deals damage to target creature equal to the number of nonbasic lands that creature's controller controls.
card.flavor:
"Finally, a good use for an Azorius courthouse."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

card.name: Whiptail Moloch
card.ability: When Whiptail Moloch enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
card.flavor:
"It wags its tail when it's happy. It wags its tail when it's angry. Nope, there's no good time to be around a whiptail."
—Rugar, Leaguehall Infirmary patient

card.name: Windreaver
card.ability:
Flying
{W}: Windreaver gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Windreaver gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Switch Windreaver's power and toughness until end of turn.
{U}: Return Windreaver to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Wit's End
card.ability: Target player discards his or her hand.
card.flavor:
"Some images are so powerful that one glance burns them into your mind forever. Come, let us gaze on nothingness."
—Szadek

card.name: Wrecking Ball
card.ability: Destroy target creature or land.
card.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.

card.name: Writ of Passage
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, if its power is 2 or less, it's unblockable this turn.
Forecast — {1}{U}, Reveal Writ of Passage from your hand: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
